page.title: 07THE AVENUE OF TREES
page.content: Near {Badbury Rings }is the B3082.Its 2.15 miles long.On both sides there is an{Avenue}of beech trees there are 23 saplings.The average girth of the trees is 2.66.The average height of the trees are 52m.The average length between each tree is 7.43.The number of trees on the right (coming along to Wimborne)366,and on the left 349. { {THE ROAD AND ITS TRAFFIC The road is undulating and most of the way down is double white lines. Half way down is a mile stone which says '{WIMBORNE}4 miles{BLANDFORD}5 miles'.At the beginning of the avenue is an(automabile assciation) call box (863).The number of roads turning of on the right is 4 and on the left is 3. The road is busy.In a servey done in May 1985 between{9.00}am and{9.15}am
